2BD57FEA9A6C42E58F673DAE030360E0.description:
Social interaction: Demonstrates respect for self by asking for
help and helping others in various physical
activities.

D6C75B9D06D742459A37FF16569EE5A9.description:
Self-expression and enjoyment: Identifies and participates in an enjoyable
activity that prompts individual selfexpression.

452661324FCB403E9A5A765F49DE30E5.description:
Self-expression and enjoyment: Discusses how enjoyment could be increased
in self-selected physical activities.

BEB6EC6B548C4805AFDF68AA22C118A8.description:
Challenge: Develops a plan of action and makes
appropriate decisions based on that plan
when faced with an individual challenge.

6D09F163625D45618FCF3BC54AE8C51E.description:
Health: Analyzes the empowering consequences of
being physically active.

E39939FE9B9348A28F88F4CCAE54BBC0.description:
Health: Identifies the 5 components of health-related
fitness (muscular strength, muscular
endurance, flexibility, cardiorespiratory
endurance, and body composition) and
explains the connections between fitness and
overall physical and mental health.

CFBDD95E372A4F36850EE667F45435D4.description:
Recognizes the value of physical activity for health, enjoyment, challenge, self-expression and/or
social interaction.:

6976D972D4C2467B813D2DFE5F70F40C.description:
Safety: Independently uses physical activity and
fitness equipment appropriately, and identifies
specific safety concerns associated with the
activity.

4DCB91CD4C4149D0A7D350030A691B54.description:
Rules and etiquette: Applies rules and etiquette by acting as an
official for modified physical activities and
games and creating dance routines within a
given set of parameters.

67F272A73D024FE2A8EC638D0BF17F1E.description:
Working with others: Cooperates with multiple classmates on
problem-solving initiatives, including
adventure activities, large-group initiatives,
and game-play.

E9425B78CBF7439884E4D00469030C0B.description:
Working with others: Responds appropriately to participants’ ethical
and unethical behavior during physical activity
by using rules and guidelines for resolving
conflicts.

A7111F02F0014BE5A1846D5CAD25A909.description:
Accepting feedback: Provides encouragement and feedback to
peers without prompting from the teacher.

DDC473D25D694078BC5313BA59A91B23.description:
Personal responsibility: Uses effective self-monitoring skills to
incorporate opportunities for physical activity
in and outside of school.

BE976D21097C461EA2799B4DD97A10D6.description:
Personal responsibility: Accepts responsibility for improving one’s own
levels of physical activity and fitness.

B355C04E7D894131940CAA83BEBC6563.description: Exhibits responsible personal and social behavior that respects self and others.:

E2DA904CB94D4867A438B5565AFC83A6.description:
Stress Management: Demonstrates basic movements used in other
stress-reducing activities, such as yoga and
tai chi.

61DE63686FE9452E903B362F312E3898.description:
Nutrition: Describes the relationship between poor
nutrition and health risk factors.

97E5395C59F74109992F607C5F93E777.description:
Assessment and program planning: Designs and implements a program to
improve levels of health-related fitness and
nutrition.

AC840A0119954C09A28B6FB13000BCCB.description:
Assessment and program planning: Designs and implements a program of
remediation for 3 areas of weakness based
on the results of health-related fitness
assessment.

33DE1C69922C49DE9E4BABF826E43164.description:
Fitness knowledge: Explains how body systems interact with one
another (e.g. blood transports nutrients from
the digestive system, oxygen from the
respiratory system) during physical activity.

0145515B918F429C8FA27375FA3D5F06.description:
Fitness knowledge: Defines how RPE Scale can be used to adjust
workout intensity during physical activity.

E680DD392FDA4B60A24AA865364137AD.description:
Fitness knowledge: Designs and implements a warm-up/cooldown regimen for a self-selected physical
activity.

57E3DE544EF84C2E972761857C3D8930.description:
Fitness knowledge: Uses the overload principle (FITT formula) in
preparing a personal workout.

31E66B0892044AAF85ABCA282477EC62.description:
Fitness knowledge: Describe the role of flexibility in injury
prevention.

257E3989098949F9B3DD7E5A518AFA28.description:
Fitness knowledge: Employs a variety of appropriate staticstretching techniques for all major muscle
groups.

08B4746BA5A84EDE81EE4D16ECAE1054.description:
Fitness knowledge: Uses available technology to self-monitor
quantity of exercise needed for a minimal
health standard and/or optimal functioning
based on current fitness level.

8BA9747ACA7D4F42B9A576754ED10E13.description:
Fitness knowledge: Compares and contrasts health-related fitness
components.

3E9A450C5DC34705A219F082672D65F8.description:
Fitness knowledge: Participates in moderate to vigorous aerobic
and/or muscle- and bone-strengthening
physical activity for at least 60 minutes per
day at least 5 times per week.

B917FF2A72CB457BADEA9F8A9F09AA5B.description:
Engages in physical activity: Participates in a self-selected lifetime sport,
dance, aquatic, or outdoor activities outside of
the school day.

7247C0C664B142BCB14C02C9EA824F55.description:
Engages in physical activity: Plans and implements a program of crosstraining to include aerobic, strength and
endurance, and flexibility training.

CE42604B2B5E4BB3A09AE704DF9C0587.description:
Engages in physical activity: Participates in a variety of self-selected
aerobic-fitness activities outside of school
such as walking, jogging, biking, skating,
dancing, and swimming.

E989F428C7FE4CE5AC7569C6085F8FFB.description:
Engages in physical activity: Participates in a physical activity 3 times a
week outside of physical education class.

5C7947368BF14C8984C2B3C2520B02FD.description:
Physical activity knowledge: Identifies the 5 components of health-related
fitness (muscular strength, muscular
endurance, flexibility, cardiorespiratory
endurance, body composition) and explains
the connections between fitness and overall
physical and mental health.

7F4DB61496B94C618FCA4FFF4F940D1F.description:
Demonstrates the knowledge and skills to achieve and maintain a health-enhancing level of
physical activity and fitness.:

D6850E6B264B48A6AA1D29287F50639B.description:
Outdoor Pursuits -Movement concepts: Implements safe protocols in self-selected
outdoor activities.

6DE506225EAC482AB9AACB04E5C59FF8.description:
Individual-performance activities,
dance and rhythms- Movement concepts: Describes and applies mechanical
advantage(s) for a variety of movement
patterns.

FD4E7EE7B02942E2B0A5D447E528E6B1.description:
Reducing space: Reduces open spaces in the field by working
with teammates to maximize coverage.

30E4FB2316894DE29856F94DC0FA8523.description:
Games and sports. Fielding and
Striking games- Offensive strategies: Identifies sacrifice situations and attempt to
advance a teammate.

D8B35AD1A5B14FCBA71DAEBA1CD2999B.description:
Games and Sports. Target games -Shot
selection: Varies the speed, force, and trajectory of the
shot based on location of the object in relation
to the target.

BC8D97B733DA4D5CBCD575104CCD44A4.description:
Using tactics and shots: Varies placement, force, and timing of return
to prevent anticipation by opponent.

6CCF4E17A70E4602A6B92B249F314189.description:
Games and Sports. Net/Wall games -
Creating Space through variation: Creates open space in net/wall games with
either a long- or short-handled implement by
varying force or direction or by moving
opponent side to side and/or forward and
back.

B13228A480AD4466B8DD4DEEB3C84FB3.description:
Transitions: Transitions from offense to defense or
defense to offense by recovering quickly,
communicating with teammates, and
capitalizing on an advantage.

9912565CA99B485CA5FAC537257E59DE.description:
Reducing space using denial: Reduces open space by not allowing the
catch (denial) and anticipating the speed of
the object or person for the purpose of
interception or deflection.

FB3E0D2B1E3D4D9B9381FA228ACC0E46.description:
Games and Sports. Invasion Games-Reducing space by changing size and
shape: Reduces open space on defense by staying
on the goal side of the offensive player and
reducing the distance to him/her (third-party
perspective).

246DF70427964FAEAC4639B0743E04F0.description:
Creating space using width and length: Creates open space by staying spread on
offense, cutting and passing quickly, and
using fakes off the ball.

917276AE8CE34D888CBCEB2F5FCBF5E5.description:
Creating space with offensive tactics: Executes at least 3 of the following offensive
tactics to create an open space: moves to
create open space on and off the ball; uses a
variety of passes, fakes, and pathways; give
and go.

24460A0850C84EE3A143F14386E63609.description:
Games and Sports. Invasion Games
Creating space with movement: Opens and closes space during small-sided
game play by combining locomotor
movements with movement concepts.

9BA4EB35A64F4C328A4CEEB836ADF665.description:
Applies knowledge of concepts, principles, strategies and tactics related to movement and
performance.:

4ECA5F5E0D39448E8B5629C77BFF08A3.description:
: Apply knowledge of critical elements of
assisting a distressed swimmer in controlled
settings.

760832D3D7164118BC8BEF24E3D69A79.description:
: Apply knowledge of critical elements of
aquatic skills: front crawl, backstroke,
breaststroke, and treading in controlled
settings.

F6AFD24D3FCE46BDABCC4804BC6C287B.description:
: Apply knowledge of critical elements of safe
water entry and exit in controlled settings.

DA4BBCB6EB10470E91AB35E6DCFC4393.description:
Individual-performance activities: Demonstrates correct technique for basic
skills in at least 2 self-selected individualperformance activities.

6458681D48534FFE93187FAB4656CE89.description:
Outdoor pursuits: Demonstrates correct technique for basic
skills in 2 self-selected outdoor activities.

D3A5C46E358745D096D0201AC2C39153.description:
Catching: Catches, using an implement, from different
trajectories and speeds in a dynamic
environment or modified game play.

8B885DB13D504D93827AC330AF5BB22A.description:
Games and Sports. Fielding/striking
games –Striking: Strikes a pitched ball with an implement for
power to open space in a variety of smallsided games. (

15340D4B0BF8446D8181281A36349691.description:
Striking: Strikes with an implement, a stationary object
for accuracy and power in such activities as
croquet, shuffleboard, or golf.

D183368DD9C74FED81DFE9EB25DFF462.description:
Games and sports. Target Games: Performs consistently (70% of the time) a
mature underhand pattern with accuracy and
control for 1 target game such as bowling or
bocce.

E50A02FB95E7454381BB3EF7A1227DF1.description:
Two handed volley: Two-hand-volleys with control in a small-sided
game.

6B86564794694C8CBE6EFC05D82D735C.description:
Volley: Forehand and backhand volleys with a mature
form and control using a short-handled
implement during modified game play.

C6E1F5578BE1427D85BE1D203635F47F.description:
Weight Transfer: Transfers weight with correct timing using
low-to-high striking pattern with a longhandled implement on the backhand side.

B5E08621A4604694A1CBBA22B0C34A5C.description:
Forehand and backhand: Demonstrates the mature form of forehand
and backhand strokes with a short- or longhandled implement with power and accuracy
in net games, such as pickleball, tennis,
badminton, or paddleball.

5A7B4E7FDBA1405AA01537F78F26813A.description:
Striking: Strikes with a mature overhand pattern in a
modified game for net/wall games such as
volleyball, handball, badminton, or tennis.

1897F2BCCF4546D28A21B12DC12F6A3B.description:
Games and sports. Net/Wall Games
Serving: Executes consistently (at least 70% of the
time) a legal underhand serve for distance
and accuracy for net/wall games such as
badminton, volleyball, or pickleball.

99A889AE92744447B1CC5F5062C1124B.description:
Defensive Skills: Drop-steps in the direction of the pass during
player-to-player defense.

C45B6ACEB2F9484098C81ECFB91CA5E4.description:
Shooting on goal: Shoots on goal with a long-handled
implement for power and accuracy in modified
invasion games such as hockey (floor, field,
or ice) or lacrosse.

63482560A9924035A9E3421C91AE5A86.description:
Dribbling/Ball Control: Foot-dribbles or dribbles with an implement
with control, changing speed and direction
during small-sided game play.

4A9E301908FD4EBC96F37B2845D47CE5.description:
Dribbling/Ball Control: Dribbles with dominant and non-dominant
hands using a change of speed and direction
in small-sided game play.

66F1137CF37240059043A2DED6A90760.description:
Offensive skills: Executes the following offensive skills during
small-sided game play: pivot, give and go,
and fakes.

FDB85492069A47DB9D92F708B1F385D4.description:
Offensive skills: Executes at least 2 of the following to create
open space during modified game play:
pivots, fakes, jab steps, screens.

B97BD494F03F4D418D6D856B87F50AD7.description:
Passing and Receiving: Throws a lead pass to a moving partner off a
dribble or pass.

DC1D8488CFBD45E19CEFCFA9301D1503.description:
Games & sports. Invasion games –
Passing and Receiving: Passes and receives with an implement in
combination with locomotor patterns of
running and change of direction, speed and/or
level with competency in modified invasion
games such as lacrosse or hockey (floor,
field, ice).

FB662DF85B86456098B1511276800D82.description:
Catching: Catches using an implement in a dynamic
environment or modified game play.

71235D59D08840218EBB779D036375FA.description:
Games & sports. Invasion and field
games – Throwing: Throws with a mature pattern for distance or
power appropriate to the activity during smallsided game play.

6977CE41E2E0471FAB69D173EC0E7909.description:
Dance and rhythms: Exhibits command of rhythm and timing by
creating a movement sequence to music as
an individual or in a group.

18C52F7B656F4A5B885482AD2207B03D.description: Demonstrates competency in a variety of motor skills and movement patterns.
